movies.title: Oh Boy!
movies.plot: A nerdy scientist comes up with a formula that turns him into a strongman.
movies.simplePlot: A nerdy scientist comes up with a formula that turns him into a strongman.

biography.bio: Albert Burdon was born on July 4, 1900 in South Shields, Northumberland, England. He was an actor, known for Heat Wave (1935), Oh Boy! (1938) and Letting in the Sunshine (1933). He died in 1981 in South Shields.
biography.name: Albert Burdon

biography.bio: Mary Lawson was born on August 30, 1910 in Darlington, Durham, England as Mary Elizabeth Lawson. She was an actress, known for Scrooge (1935), House Broken (1936) and A Fire Has Been Arranged (1935). She was married to L.C. Beaumont. She died on May 4, 1941 in Liverpool, England.
biography.name: Mary Lawson

biography.placeOfBirth: New York City, New York, USA
biography.bio: Bernard Nedell was born on October 14, 1893 in New York City, New York, USA as Bernard Jay Nedell. He is known for his work on Monsieur Verdoux (1947), Come Across (1938) and The Man from Chicago (1930). He was married to Olive Blakeney. He died on November 23, 1972 in Hollywood, California, USA.
biography.name: Bernard Nedell

biography.bio: James Alexander Chapman was born on May 31, 1879 in Birmingham, West Midlands, England as Jay Chapman. He was an actor, known for Pyjamas Preferred (1932), I'll Stick to You (1933) and The Black Tulip (1937). He was married to Mollie Griffin and Sybil Viney. He died on April 8, 1969 in Durban, South Africa.
biography.name: James Alexander Chapman

biography.bio: Robert Cochran was born on February 20, 1906 in Glasgow, Scotland as Robert Turnbull Cochran. He was an actor, known for Scrooge (1935), Sanders of the River (1935) and The Man Who Could Work Miracles (1936). He died in 1977 in Kensington, London, England.
biography.name: Robert Cochran

biography.bio: Edmon Ryan was born on June 5, 1905 in Cecilia, Kentucky, USA as Edmon Ryan Mossbarger. He was an actor, known for Topaz (1969), Tora! Tora! Tora! (1970) and Two for the Seesaw (1962). He was married to Anne Sargent. He died on August 4, 1984 in Louisville, Kentucky.
biography.name: Edmon Ryan

biography.bio: Maire O'Neill was born on January 12, 1885 in Dublin, Ireland as Molly Allgood. She was an actress, known for The Shame of Mary Boyle (1929), A Christmas Carol (1951) and Sidewalks of London (1938). She was married to Arthur Sinclair and G.H. Mair. She died on November 2, 1952 in Belfast, Northern Ireland.
biography.name: Maire O'Neill

biography.bio: Syd Walker was born on March 22, 1886 in Salford, England. He was an actor, known for What Would You Do, Chums? (1939), Old Bill Through the Ages (1924) and Who Is Guilty? (1939). He died on January 13, 1945 in Hove, East Sussex, England.
biography.name: Syd Walker

biography.bio: Charles Carson was born on August 16, 1885 in London, England. He was an actor, known for Secret Agent (1936), The Dam Busters (1955) and Cry, the Beloved Country (1951). He was married to Bertha Kathleen Elmes. He died on August 5, 1977 in London.
biography.name: Charles Carson

biography.bio: Jerry Verno was one of those picturesque cockney actors that made British pictures irresistible. Michael Powell gave him leading parts in four of his first films before using him again in his classic The Red Shoes (1948) as George, the stage door keeper. But as of the mid-thirties Verno only got minor parts, although very conspicuous ones: a Cockney never goes unnoticed. Impossible to miss him as the commercial traveler in his two Hitchcock films The 39 Steps (1935) and as the lorry driver in The Girl Was Young (1937). All in all, Verno's film career may seem modest but it must not be overlooked that he worked from childhood (he started as a boy vocalist) to old age in variety, pantomime, theater, musicals and television. You can't be everywhere at the same time!
biography.name: Jerry Verno

biography.bio: John Wood was born on November 11, 1909 in Sydney, New South Wales, Australia. He was an actor, known for The Last Days of Pompeii (1935), Stolen Face (1952) and North Sea Patrol (1938). He died on March 1, 1965 in Australia.
biography.name: John Wood

biography.bio: Billy Milton was born on December 8, 1905 in Paddington, London, England as William Thomas Milton. He was an actor and composer, known for Saturday Night Revue (1937), Monster of Terror (1965) and Someone at the Door (1936). He died on November 22, 1989 in Denville Hall, Northwood, London.
biography.name: Billy Milton

filmingLocations.location: British International Pictures, Borehamwood, Hertfordshire, England, UK
